intro: Cymopterus longipes var. longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its stems are erect and often branched. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, elliptical seeds.
